alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued October 06 at 4:41PM PDT until October 06 at 5:45PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southeastern San Diego County in southwestern California... * Until 545 PM PDT. * At 437 PM PDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Ocotillo Wells to 14 miles south of Boulevard, moving west at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Interstate 8 east of San Diego towards the desert will be impacted. Locations impacted include... Borrego Springs, east of Pine Valley, I-8, and Hwy 78. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
